arm_group.description: autologous bone marrow mononuclear cell transplantation

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study was to study the safety and effect of stem cell therapy on the
      functional recovery in patients with chronic stroke.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Autologous Stem Cell Therapy in Chronic Stroke

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  males and females

          -  above 18 years of age

          -  diagnosed as stroke by clinical and MRI findings

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  presence of respiratory distress

          -  presence of acute infections such as Human Immunodeficient Virus/Hepatitis B
             Virus/Hepatitis C Virus

          -  malignancies

          -  acute medical conditions such as respiratory infection, fever

          -  hemoglobin less than 8

          -  bleeding tendency

          -  bone marrow disorder

          -  left ventricular ejection fraction < 30%

          -  pregnancy or breastfeeding

intervention.description: bone marrow derived mononuclear cells are administered intrathecally in chronic stroke patients
intervention.intervention_name: Autologous bone marrow mononuclear cell transplantation

clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study of Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Cells Intrathecal Transplantation in Chronic Stroke

oversight_info.authority: India: Indian Council of Medical Research

reference.citation: Borlongan CV. Bone marrow stem cell mobilization in stroke: a 'bonehead' may be good after all! Leukemia. 2011 Nov;25(11):1674-86. doi: 10.1038/leu.2011.167. Epub 2011 Jul 5. Review.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
